summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting a large volume of discovery materials. The materials include financial records from Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase, Citibank, UBS, and American Express related to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and various associated entities and trusts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). Financial records for her and entities associated with her are being produced as part of discovery.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: American Express records for him are included in the discovery production. He is the central figure in the underlying criminal conspiracy.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of this discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of this discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of this discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of this discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signatory of the letter, representing the U.S. Department of Justice in the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Shared American Express records are part of the discovery, indicating intertwined financial dealings.
Everdell is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery for Maxwell.
Cohen is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery for Maxwell.
Menninger is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery for Maxwell.
Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery for Maxwell.
Strauss, as the Acting U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor opposing Maxwell in the criminal case.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Defense Request for Files
events.description: The defense sent a letter specifying files they requested, which the government is reproducing in this production.

events.title: Discovery Production to Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a massive volume of financial records and other materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team as part of ongoing discovery obligations.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced a vast discovery set (over 150,000 pages based on Bates numbers) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including financial records from major banks.
The financial records pertain to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and several entities/trusts including Angara Trust, Montepelier Trust, Terramar Project, Inc., Max Foundation, and Ellmax, LLC.
The production is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, designating much of the material as confidential.
The discovery includes American Express records for both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating a focus on their joint and several financial activities.
The document reveals the ongoing and extensive nature of the financial investigation into the Epstein-Maxwell enterprise.
